intro: Biscutella valentina var. lucida, commonly known as the shining biscutella, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important plants such as mustard and cabbage. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink, and its hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in alpine or subalpine environments. The varietal name 'lucida' refers to its shiny or glossy appearance, particularly on the leaves and stems.
